descriptionHtml:
Cow Calves (heifers) in Skyrim by GreyFox77

[size=4][b] - 29-01-2015 v1.1 ESP, adding calves to Skyrim.[/b][/size]
All calves were added to locations where cows are already present.
ESP cleaned with TES5Edit.

Falkreath exterior farm - added 1 calf
Whiterun Plains District - added 1 calf
Merryfair Farm - added 1 calf
Snow-Shod Farm - added 1 calf
Battle-Born Farm - added 2 calves
Pelagia Farm - added 1 calf
Chillfurrow Farm - added 1 calf
Riverwood - added 1 calf
Loreius Farm - added 1 calf
Rorikstead - added 2 calves

[i] - 29-01-2015 v1.0 Initial release[/i]

Description
=================================
To my surprise I could not find any remodels or mods that add cow calves to Skyrim (unless I missed it).

Differences with the normal cow model are:
 - Removed horns
 - Udder greatly shrunk
 - Tail shortened

No changes made to:
 - Texture, uses standard Cow texture
 - Uses vanilla Cow skeleton, so its compatible with new animations etc
 - Calves added by the ESP use the same Package as vanilla cows (a Sandbox package, radius 256 from editor location) and will use the cow Idle Markers

Suggestions welcome.
This resource can be used freely, but please list me in your credits if you release any mod containing this mesh.





Mesh resource usage
=================================
To put it ingame in your own mod you will have to copy/duplicate [b]Armor[/b] entry "SkinCow" and [b]Armor Addon[/b] entry "NakedCowAA".
Point your new [b]Armor[/b] entry's Models list (Armor dialog, on the lower-right) to your new Calf [b]Armor Addon[/b].
Duplicate [b]Actor/NPC [/b]EncCow, change Skin (on Traits tab) to your new calf [b]Armor[/b] entry.
Change [b]Actor/NPC[/b] Height to 0.7 (for example).

Credits
=================================
Thanks to Bethesda and Nexusmods.

Legal
=================================
Please credit me if you distribute this mesh as part of a mod.

Cheers.
author: GreyFox77
